exec: //tests["Validating if response time is less than 10000ms"] = responseTime < postman.getEnvironmentVariable("ResponseTime") ;   //validate response time
tests["Validating if Status code is 200"] = responseCode.code === 200;
tests["Validating if Status code name has string"] = responseCode.name.has("OK");
tests["Newly created User group is present"] = (function() {

request.description:
Description

This operation returns a list of user groups. [_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/get_user_group.htm)

originalRequest.description:

header.name: Content-Length
header.description: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: X-Powered-By
header.description: Specifies the technology (ASP.NET, PHP, JBoss, e.g.) supporting the web application (version details are often in X-Runtime, X-Version, or X-AspNet-Version)

request.description:
This operation returns a list of client computer groups.

request.description:
This operation creates a client computer group.

http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_client_group.htm

exec: tests["Status code is 200"] = responseCode.code === 200;            //validate status code
tests["Status code name has string"] = responseCode.name.has("OK");
tests["Validating if Status code is 200"] = responseCode.code === 200;
if((tests["Validating roleName End Users"] = responseBody.has("End Users")))
if((tests["Validating roleName Client Admins"] = responseBody.has("Client Admins")))
if((tests["Validating roleName All Users Laptops"] = responseBody.has("All Users Laptops")))
console.log("roleName All Users Laptops is present");
